subdefinitions.definition: That which causes something: an efficient cause , a proximate cause .
examples: The reason this tree fell is that it had rotted.

subdefinitions.definition: A motive for an action or a determination.
examples: The reason I robbed the bank was that I needed the money.
If you don't give me a reason to go with you, I won't.

subdefinitions.definition: An excuse : a thought or a consideration offered in support of a determination or an opinion; that which is offered or accepted as an explanation.
( logic ) A premise placed after its conclusion .

definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) Rational thinking (or the capacity for it); the cognitive faculties , collectively, of conception , judgment , deduction and intuition .
examples: Mankind should develop reason above all other virtues.

definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) Something reasonable , in accordance with thought; justice .

secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) Rational thinking (or the capacity for it); the cognitive faculties , collectively, of conception , judgment , deduction and intuition .
( obsolete ) Something reasonable , in accordance with thought; justice .
